alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 1:29PM MDT until April 22 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota... Snake Creek near Ashton affecting Spink County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake Creek near Ashton. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge 1 mile east of the gauge and the bridge 1 mile northwest of the gauge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM CDT Tuesday was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening by 1030 PM CDT.
